runs.comm: tossed up outside off stump and pushed through the covers on the front foot
short and a touch wide, Amla rocks back and cuts through point for the first boundary of the innigns
turn for Briggs, Amla stepping away and launching an expansive drive, it beating past the outside edge and Kieswetter demolishes the stumps for good measure
more spin, this pitches on middle and rips past the outside edge as Amla pushes forward
tossed up on off stump, straightening and Amla is hit on the pad trying to reverse sweep, may have been outside the line and height was also an issue
flighted outside off and slapped flamboyantly over extra-cover, Morgan runs round from long-off but can't get there
full and angling in, Levi falls over slightly and is hit on the pad, big appeal but it was sliding past leg
pitched up on the stumps and dug out towards point

full and straight and bowled him! Levi tried an ungainly heave across the line as Bresnan sent down an offcutter, not quite yorker length but it dips under the stroke and through to rattle the  stumps
full and slightly wide, reaches for it and pushes off the outer edge of the face through point, almost gets to the rope but Michael Lumb does superbly to rein it in
length ball outside off, Amla shuffles across and tries to flick to leg, is hit on the pad but outside the line
forker wide of the stumps and squeezed into the off side for a quick single
full length, outside the line of off, slashed via a thick edge down to third man, who can't cut it off
back of a length and at the body, tries to pull and the ball gets lost between bat, glove and pad, falling to the ground past the stumps and they steal one
lovely shot from du Plessis, reaching out to upbraid a length ball over mid-off and away for four, excellent timing
foxed this time, though, a slower bouncer and du Plessis has no idea where the ball has gone, it squirts behind point for one
short, takes the pace off again, Amla adjusts and flips to square leg
full speed bouncer this time ... too high for the umpires' liking
another slower-ball bouncer, du Plessis can't time his attempt to pull and gets a bottom edge that bobbles through to the keeper
length ball outside off, maybe a touch short and Amla waits before cracking a back cut away through backward point
skips out and lofted over extra-cover this time, the two fielders converge to keep the damage down
slightly short of a length outside off and tapped through point
spears this down the leg side, scraps the pad and rolls behind square
full length on leg stump, fired in quicker and deflected to short third man off the pad

tossed up, works across the line ... and gone, looped to mid-off! The ball ballooned off a leading edge, completely the opposite direction to where du Plessis intended and Briggs has his first T20I wicket
length ball, spinning in towards off stump, plays with the turn to square leg
full and flighted on off, Amla delicately reverse dabs for four to very fine third man - another extraordinary from a batsman in wonderful form
full and on off again, swept hard through square leg
touch shorter, hops back and pulls through midwicket
tossed up outside off, again tries to reverse paddle, Kieswetter had moved across but in the end the ball hits the toe of the bat and plops on to the pitch
flighted, bit of dip and Amla leaves the crease, drives away from his body and thick-edges past the keeper, Briggs this time doing superb work to chase and prevent four
dug in short, good pace and Amla misses trying to trampoline the ball to third man
another steepling bouncer, Amla advances, tries to uppercut again - but that's another wide on height, and it was above head height
short of a length outside off, Amla mistimes a swing outside off, bottom-edging low to the keeper
full, quick and wide of the stumps as Amla backs away ... another swing and a miss
pitched up wide of off stump, cuts hard, off the toe end of the bat, deflected by cover and they get two
back of a length, at the body and cracked with an Indiana Jones whip of the wrists flat through midwicket for four
length ball, at the stump, takes the pace off and again dupes Amla - not often you can say that - who throws the bat and misses

full and outside off stump, slogged into the deep and gone! De Villiers got under the slog-sweep but it wasn't off the middle, trying to drag it to deep midwicket and Bairstow took a good running catch
flighted outside the line of off, full length and Amla advances, bullets a drive at cover, who makes an excellent, finger-smarting stop
turn for Swann, round the wicket and tossed up, drifting in and then spinning past Morkel's prod
tossed up and this time Morkel misses trying to reverse sweep, the ball running away to short third man
huuuuuuuuuuuge turn for Swann but it fractionally misses leg stump as Amla steps outside off and misses trying to pull to leg

hoicked into the deep and England have the key wicket of Amla! Swann slid this towards leg stump as Amla stepped away, tried to give it some tap but could only pick out the man at deep midwicket with a flat pull shot
full, pacy yorker outside off stump, dug out behind point for one
length ball speared across, beats Morkel's dabble outside off
full speed ahead from Dermbach, back of a length and on line, Morkel swings and misses again
slower ball this time, legcutter on the stumps, worked into the on side
fast yorker outside the line of off, Ontong steps away but can't get his bat under it
another slower ball, sliding down past leg stump and Ontong gives himself to try and hit over midwicket ... but he doesn't pick and carves out a fresh chunk of air
full and on the stumps, chopped away to wide long-on and they get back for two, much to Swann's displeasure
pushed through, pulled through midwicket
tossed up outside off, heaved in the air over midwicket, Bairstow fields well on the bounce
round the wicket, pushed through on off stump and chopped behind point
tossed up on off stump, Ontong gets to the pitch of this one and spanks it high, high, hiiiiiiiiiiiiigh over deep midwicket
fired in full and fast on middle stump, digs the ball out to long-on for a couple
length ball on the stumps, nudged off the pads to long leg for one

full toss, skewed to point and Ontong has to go! The batsman wasn't happy about the height but it was probably just below the waist, it seemed to surprise Ontong, who went for the old heave ho only to top edge to the man on the edge of the circle
smeared over deep square leg, that's a monstrous six with just a flick of the wrists
length ball on the stumps, pulled flat this time to deep square
full and on leg stump, manages to jam the bat down and the get the ball to long-on
full length and well wide of the stumps, Morkel throws his bat at it and pings one to deep point
this goes completely wrong, out the back of the hand and off the cut strip wide of Morkel's off stump - not quite as off line as Morkel's earlier in the day but still pretty whiffy
pitched up outside off, regulation fast ball, dug out to cover
touch short of a length, down the leg side - another wide
low full toss on leg stump, Kallis swings hard but can only drill the ball along the ground to long-on
pitched up in the channel outside off, leans back and chops down the ground, long-on has to come across straighter but they only pick up two
another slower ball, lobbed high into the off side ... and Lumb drops it! It seemed to go over his head, as the fielder ran in from deep extra-cover. England still can't bag 'em
full and wide of the off stump, drilled low through cover to Lumb on the rope
another full bunger outside off, Morkel can't get under it, hacking low to third man - meaning England win by 28 runs
